title: Instruction Guidelines for Instructors: Libraries - Northwestern University
content: Contact your subject librarian to talk about ways you can teach with the Libraries, or complete the instruction request form to get started. In a library instruction session, subject librarians collaborate with faculty to provide point-of-need instruction on disciplinary research skills and specific resources available through the library. To design an effective library instruction session, a librarian may request an initial consultation with you. During that consultation, we hope to discuss the following: See rubric instead on Northwestern Sharepoint (requires login with NetID).
